title: Can a parent ever forgive the person who killed their child?
text:
When their son Harry was killed in a car accident in August, Tim Dunn and Charlotte Charles couldn’t have known that they would soon be at the centre of a diplomatic war. They were grieving for their 19-year-old boy when the person responsible for his death, Anne Sacoolas, used diplomatic immunity to leave the country.

The trauma of losing a child was exacerbated by the fear his killer could escape justice.

Sacoolas has since apologised for the fatal crash in which Harry’s motorbike collided with her car outside an RAF base in Northamptonshire, but she has ignored repeated requests for her to return to the UK.

In an unprecedented move, the Dunn family this week went to the White House to beg...
